data.title: Gabriella
data.meta_description: The name Gabriella has a biblical influence that makes it popular with people of the Christian faith, particularly Catholics. While […]
data.text:
The name Gabriella has a biblical influence that makes it popular with people of the Christian faith, particularly Catholics. While it is largely considered an Italian name, it's popular in German and Hungary and among Latinos. It's also popular within the Jewish community in the United States. Many girls named Gabriella prefer to go by shorter cute nicknames, like Gabby, Gabe, or Ella.

Meaning and Origin of the name Gabriella:

Gabriella is a girl's name of Hebrew origin meaning “God is my strength.”

Gabriella is an Italian name. It's the feminine version of the Hebrew name Gabriel, which means “God is my strength.” Gabriel is comprised of the Hebrew géver (meaning “strong man”) and ‘el (meaning “God”).

Symbolism of the name Gabriella:

Because Gabriella is considered the feminine version of the Hebrew name Gabriel, many people — particularly Christians — feel that the name is a strong symbol of their faith. In the Bible, Gabriel was an archangel who proclaimed Jesus's birth to Mary.

Nicknames for the name Gabriella:

Gabriella is an elegant girl's name that is rich in biblical history. If you are considering naming your daughter Gabriella and are looking for nicknames, take a look at the list below. We compiled the nicknames for Gabriella, and they are all cute options.

Gabby

Gabbie

Gabe

Ella

Bella

Gab

Gaby

Gabi

Gabri

Abby

Brie

Style of the name Gabriella:

Classic

Gender of the name Gabriella:

Gabriella is a girl's name.

Pronunciation of the name Gabriella:

GAB-ree-El-uh

Number of syllables in the name Gabriella:

Four

Emotion evoked from the name Gabriella:

The baby name Gabriella evokes a sense of romance, elegance and femininity.

Alternative spellings for the name Gabriella:

Gabriela

Popularity of the name Gabriella:

Gabriella first made the Social Security Administrations list of the top baby names for girls in 1974. It placed at 995. Since then, it has risen in popularity, and as of 2020, it was the 77th-most popular name for baby girls in the United States.

Related names for the name Gabriella:

Gabrielle

Gabby

Isabella

Daniella

Great middle names for Gabriella and their meanings:

Nicole (people of victory)

Joy (happiness)

Marie(star of the sea)

Faith (confidence and trust)

Diane (divine)

Rose (flower)

Madison (son of Matthew)

Grace (God's grace)

Noelle (Christmas)

Anne (gracious, merciful)

Paige (servant or helper)

Famous people with the name Gabriella:

Gabriella Wilde (actress)

Gabriella Cilmi (singer)

Gabriella Ferri (singer)

Gabriella Ambrosio (journalist and author)

Gabriella Fagundez (Olympic swimmer)

Princess Gabriella, Countess of Carladès (Princess of Monaco)

Gabriellas in popular culture:

Gabriella Dante (character on the TV show “The Sopranos”)

Gabriella Einarsdotter (character in the book series “The Bert Diaries”)

Gabriella Montez (character in the “High School Musical” Disney series)
